Name: AI Could Help Here!
Summary: Identifies ways AI and GPTs can improve your life suggesting concrete use-cases
Sample Prompt: How could I use a GPT to help me prepare for an upcoming roundtable event?

Name: Boss Update Batcher
Summary: GPT to create a running log of updates for a boss
Daniel Notes: Idea is to gather and consolidate status updates (for output it reformats). Cautiously optimistic. If reliable (memory functionality is vital) this could be really helpful
Sample Prompt: Please add [update] to the next batch of updates for [boss]

Name: Brainstorming Assistant
Summary: GPT which provides guidance to help the user have effective brainstorming sessions
Daniel Notes: Built for internal use / deadline highlighter intended to jump time specific items to the top of the agenda
Sample Prompt: Can we start a brainstorming session please to advance preparations for [X]?

Name: Brief Generator
Summary: Summarizes and organizes activities into brief reports with highlights for deadlines.
Daniel Notes: Built for my work but actually does a pretty nice job
Sample Prompt: Can you prepare a brief for my boss summarising the outcome of the following meeting? [Text]

Name: Custom GPT Creator Wizard
Summary: Helps brainstorm and create custom GPTs with detailed instructions.
Daniel Notes: Helps with creating useful custom GPTs on top of OpenAI
Sample Prompt: What kind of GPTs could I create to help identify journalists who may be interested in [topic] and what configuration parameters might be most helpful?

Name: Daily Schedule Manager
Summary: GPT for creating a daily schedule
Sample Prompt: Can you help me to create a work plan for today?

Name: Data Visualisation & Storytelling Guide
Summary: Guides users towards thinking about how data could be effectively visualised including through leveraging mixed media.
Daniel Notes: Idea is to suggest specific data vis formats for a given dataset. I see potential in this one in trying to nudge me to think beyond the rather staid and boring formats like pie charts!
Sample Prompt: Please take a look at this dataset. What visualisations could I use to highlight some of its most interesting findings?

Name: Document Stats And Numbers Miner
Summary: A GPT which parses user-uploaded documents and identifies statistics and data tables contained in them. The GPT outputs a report attempting to assess how noteworthy the stats are.
Daniel Notes: Idea here was to quickly flag mentioned datapoints in docs
Sample Prompt: Can you please identify any statistics in this dataset?

Name: Document Table Finder
Summary: Reviews documents to identify and list data tables with summaries and page references.
Daniel Notes: As above but specifically looks for tables

Name: Do We Really Need This Meeting?
Summary: An organisation to screen out unnecessary meetings and suggest alternative approaches

Name: Email Optimiser
Summary: Refines and organizes draft emails, suggesting subject lines and reformatting content.
Daniel Notes: This one has proven extremely useful. Reformats text by prefacing it with a TL;DR section and parses input text for any deadlines/time-sensitive items and bumps them up when dectected
Sample Prompt: Can you please reformat this meeting for easy reading for recipients? [Email]

Name: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Data Finder
Summary: A GPT whose purpose is to help the user identify datasets containing companies' GHG emissions data
Daniel Notes: Decent scraping tool to try track down elusive GHG data as it's released
Sample Prompt: Has [company] published any data in the past year thata includes its emissions data?

Name: If We Don't Change...
Summary: A GPT to highlight the potential costs of humanity failing to tackle vital issues including climate change
Daniel Notes: Scenario-modelling human inactivity and its probable effects on the planet + SDG progress

Name: Impact Investing Digest
Summary: Summarizes developments in the world of impact investing
Daniel Notes: As with every web scraping GPT this one has to be used with caution but so far I've found it helpful. Expect results to improve as OpenAI's models iterate
Sample Prompt: Can you please provide a summary of major news items in the world of impact investing over the past week?

Name: Media Monitoring Brief Assistant
Summary: Prepares customised briefs about a specific topic taking inputs from the user
Daniel Notes: Helpful. Try running it on specific keywords and timeframe limiters

Name: Media Monitoring Helper
Summary: A media monitoring assistant focusd on helping monitor for personal coverage
Daniel Notes: Context isn't set for any one individual so you need to state it every time

Name: Media Opportunity Screener
Summary: Conducts background research on inbound media requests and offers assessments as to likely reach
Daniel Notes: Built for my own use to quickly triage inbound media requests. Outputs stats about probable reach.
Sample Prompt: We've received an interview request from [X]. Can you please provide an assessment of the request and provide numbers for this outlet's reputation and estimated reach?

Name: Media Outreach Assistant
Summary: Helps the user to develop media lists suggesting relevant journalists to contact
Daniel Notes: Mixed results but very much worth playing aorund with

Name: Meeting Agenda Assistant
Summary: A GPT to assist in crafting professional and well-organised meeting agendas
Daniel Notes: Super useful for quickly formatting a string of text into an organised agenda
Sample Prompt: Can you please reformat this text into a meeting agenda?

Name: Meeting Minutes Recorder
Summary: Records and organizes minutes of meetings automatically.
Daniel Notes: Ditto. Set this up so that you can log notes on the go or afterwards. Reformats them so that you can capture them elsewhere.

Name: Monetised GHG Emissions Simulator (Carbon Pricing)
Summary: A GPT which models financial accounts based upon two recently proposed options for the social cost of carbon
Daniel Notes: Baked in the IFVI rate of $236/tonne. Another direction would be to calculate the EPA rate too and then compute the difference
Sample Prompt: Can you please extract figures from this report and simulate a "monetisation" of the emissions data? Can you output that data as text and as CSV?

Name: New Statistics Locator
Summary: A GPT which attempts to identify new statistics which might be of interest to the user
Sample Prompt: We're using this stat [stat]. Is an updated number available?

Name: Open Data Finder
Summary: Finds open source datasets based on user queries.
Daniel Notes: Developed to try to improve discovery of sustainability related open datasets
Sample Prompt: Can you please try to list open datasets that have to do with climate change tracking and which were published over the past 6 months? Please divide the output between national governments and multilateral organisations

Name: Organisation Relationship Finder
Summary: A GPT to help map out relationships between organisations and identify associated organisations
Daniel Notes: Actually one of the GPTs I'm more excited about. My idea was to use this to dredge up the "long tail" of orgs that are easy to miss
Sample Prompt: I'm interested in the work that [org] is doing around [focus area]. Can you suggest 50 related organisations which it might be worth engaging with?

Name: Quick Email Template Generator
Summary: A GPT for creating email templates when you need to repeat similar content in multiple emails
Daniel Notes: For day to day use very useful

Name: Recent Report Finder
Summary: A GPT for finding recently published reports within a user's area of interest
Daniel Notes: Worth trying. My idea was to find reports with this and then summarise in the summariser as a way of keeping on top of the ever growing body of research and reports in the space
Sample Prompt: Can you please identify recent reports about [topic]?

Name: Regulation & Policy Comparison Assistant
Summary: A GPT to compare different policies and regulations
Daniel Notes: Thought this one could be fun to play around with for producing simple comparisons of things like SFDR vs. SEC or SEC vs California reg
Sample Prompt: Can you prepare a briefing document summarising the various instruments governing financial sustainability disclosures affecting companies in Europe, please?

Name: Report Summariser
Summary: A GPT which summarises reports with a particular focus on data and statistics contained in them
Daniel Notes: Attempts to summarise reports intelligently
Sample Prompt: Please produce a summary of this report

Name: Stat Update Helper
Summary: Helps users update old statistics with reliable new data.

Name: Sustainability Report Finder
Summary: A research utility for discovering sustainability reports

Name: Sustainable Living Advisor
Summary: A GPT which provides concrete sustainable living recommendations based upon user requests

Name: The Checklist Pro
Summary: Generates tailored checklists to ensure safety, preparedness, and completeness for various activities and contexts.
Sample Prompt: Can you generate a checklist that I can use before a weekly catch up meeting?

Name: The Professional Skeptic
Summary: A GPT designed to probe claims and push sources
Sample Prompt: Take a look at this document and suggest some flaws in the logic or claims to be wary of

Name: Weekly Work Planner
Summary: Helps the user formulate a weekly work plan
